channel.title: The Internet and being an Asshole
channel.description:
So, since I made this account I have essentially wondered the forums and gone around being a superior asshole to people. As a result I have gained 60 reputation. So, my question is thus: Is the internet just a place for people to express their extreme pent-up hatred for everyone else? OR does everyone just enjoy being a dick as much as I do?
I feel that at a basic human level people love to express their superiority over others and other people like to be able to see someone else suffer and go: "At least I am not as stupid as them.", regardless of the truth of that thought.
Now, quite frankly, I have enjoyed myself so much that I am happy for people to just have a massive argument with me that quickly deteriorates into insulting each other's mothers (something which every argument seems to end on) but some actual discussion is also welcome. :)
(I like to think of myself as a researcher rather than an asshole :P)

item.title: The Internet and being an Asshole
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

[quote=“BorigTheDwarf, post:24, topic:439910”][quote author=(N)eon link=topic=542598.msg3976660#msg3976660 date=1334718324]
OP Rep means nothing…
[/quote]

And why should this be the case? Surely the whole system should then be removed.

gets 60 rep
allowed to complain on forums

Welcome to the internet. Get used to it, this is just how people are. Don’t be a hypocrite either, you’ve done it before. There is a very small % of people that wouldn’t do something wrong or immoral if they could get away with it 100% no chance of failure. On the internet, there are no consequences for calling someone a retard or a fag. It’s just how everything works. Keep in mind that reading sarcasm is also a lot harder then listening to it, you faggot.

Hates change
refuses to discuss alternatives to the way things are currently done

M8, your life is one wretched hole of disappointment and failure.[/quote]
Well wasn’t that just one completely incorrect assumption?

Read full topic
item.source: The Internet and being an Asshole

Bitch slaps newfag
Demands your children for devouring

item.title: The Internet and being an Asshole
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“BorigTheDwarf, post:6, topic:439910”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=542598.msg3976305#msg3976305 date=1334696572]

[quote author=tinyscape link=topic=542598.msg3976300#msg3976300 date=1334696430]

People find that they can bully somebody online a lot easier than in real life.
[/quote]Because you know you wont get a fist to the face if you say bad things to random people online.
[/quote]sort of like when I informed you your cyer gf was cheating on you with me…you couldn’t punch me <3

Well that’s just the thing. And is it a good thing or a bad thing? Removing the threat of physical harm means that people actually feel comfortable to express their true opinion, and, obviously, in some cases this is a truly bad idea. A great example of this is people who are dumping their boyfriend, girlfriend, husband etc over the internet. IRL they wouldn’t have the guts to do this and may have just stuck it out, whereas over the internet it is easy and impersonal and means that relationships can become a lot more fragile.[/quote]I’d slap dat woman if she tried to dump me online lols

Read full topic

[/quote]Because you know you wont get a fist to the face if you say bad things to random people online.
[/quote]sort of like when I informed you your cyer gf was cheating on you with me…you couldn’t punch me <3[/quote]

Well that’s just the thing. And is it a good thing or a bad thing? Removing the threat of physical harm means that people actually feel comfortable to express their true opinion, and, obviously, in some cases this is a truly bad idea. A great example of this is people who are dumping their boyfriend, girlfriend, husband etc over the internet. IRL they wouldn’t have the guts to do this and may have just stuck it out, whereas over the internet it is easy and impersonal and means that relationships can become a lot more fragile.
